title: Can riot do something about people that brag and show off the fact they are a smurf?
body:
Does this sound familiar to any of you 
"GG get rekt you piece of shit." 
"It's not that i'm good, it's just that you're trash."
"I'm only platinum, I'm just boosting my girlfriend up so she can duo with me on my main." 
"Look, my real account is ******* op.gg it, you'll see i'm telling the truth." 

- Checks their match history to see nothing but overwhelming positive kdas and winning streaks.

replies.body: Y'know, I sympathize with this quiiiiite a bit actually. Smurfing can lead to people of far higher skill levels playing in much lower tiers than they should which can lead to this behavior. Overall, there's a lot of ways that smurfs let people skirt the rules and systems in their favor. There's nothing I can personally do about smurfs, since everyone has the right to their account, but if they're acting this way I would personally report them in post-game for toxicity or boosting if they claim it. Always make use of reporting, otherwise, we can't take action.

If they're claiming to be a smurf, but not claiming to be boosting - 
Is it still bannable? 

I know riot has a code of "It's shit talk in game." versus "harassment." 
Trash talk is an integral part of "competitive" games so Its one of those things where I'm curious as to how you value or judge it.
